newsitem.title: FRANCE: SOCCER-LOKO FACES TRIAL FOR UNRULY BEHAVIOUR.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-LOKO FACES TRIAL FOR UNRULY BEHAVIOUR.

text.p: France international Patrice Loko has been ordered to face trial following his arrest for violent behaviour 21 months ago, court sources said on Friday.
The 27-year-old striker, who had just joined Paris St Germain from Nantes, was taken to hospital after damaging parked cars outside a Champs Elysees discotheque in the early hours of July 20, 1995.
Loko, disturbed by a recent separation, was taken into custody after acting aggressively towards hospital staff. While in custody he exhibited himself to a female police inspector.
He was put under judiciary surveillance and psychiatric treatment and regained his place in the French national team.
